long: The noun benediction comes from the Latin roots bene, meaning "well" and diction meaning "to speak" ā literally to speak well of. Although it is most often used in the religious sense of prayer and blessing ā especially a ceremonial prayer at the end of a church service ā it can mean any expression of good wishes. "Good luck on the test!" the mother cried in benediction as her son set off for school.
